result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald E. Splittgerber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $250.00 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The Court defers to agent the issue of no contact with N. S.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald E. Splittgerber

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald E. Splittgerber
Current: W366 Buttercup Ct, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 03-14-2017)
Prior: 358 Monroe St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States

16CM-23 and 16CM-158 - Both Cases Called. Defendant Ronald E. Splittgerber in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Def as to status of counsel.  Def requests to speak with the State on resolution w/o counsel.  Off Rcord for Defendant to speak with the State.  Back of Record @ 2:08 PM:  Global resolution recited by ADA.  Defendant confirms resolution reached.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. ADA confirms that any claim for Rest is withdrawn as to 16CM-23 based on performance.  16CM-158 Plea: GP   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Statement by Def:  Yes - requests no contact provisions be dropped.  The Court:  Will follow recommendation - S/W as to both cases - 1 yr. probation with concurrent terms.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court defers to agent the issue of no contact with N.S.; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP - Bond to be applied of $250 to be applied. DNA Sample ordered, unless previously provided and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  3 days TS credit.  Appeal Rights Given.
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case Called @ 11:48 AM: Defendant Ronald E. Splittgerber in court, appearing pro se.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Per DA:  There has been partial performance as to repairs already accomplished by Def.  Pictures on Def's cell phone were reviewed prior to going of record. DA requests add'l time to complete repairs. Statement by Def as to repairs that need completion.  SEH adjourned upon request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Updated Restitution Summary - $1005.00
Sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 11:45 am

2:04 pm case called. Defendant Ronald E. Splittgerber in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached-argued sentence.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2.  Sentencing argument by DA. Sentencing argument by defendant. Court adjourns matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-26-2016 02:00 pm

9:18 am case called. Defendant Ronald E. Splittgerber in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant wishes to discuss the matter with the DA-waiving his waiver of right to counsel. Offer has been extended to the defendant and defendant requests time to look over the offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
